meanings.sent1: In wedlock, two people promise to be together forever.
meanings.sent2: They celebrated their love by entering into wedlock.
meanings.sent3: After years of wedlock, they still argue over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: Their wedlock was like a sturdy ship sailing through the storms of life.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of their wedlock shone brightly in the eyes of their children.

meanings.definition: The legal union of a man and woman as husband and wife
meanings.sent1: Their families gathered to witness their wedlock ceremony.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, wedlock is a sacred bond between two individuals.
meanings.sent3: The judge declared them husband and wife, sealing their wedlock with a stamp.
meanings.sent4: Their wedlock was a fortress of love, protecting them from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of their wedlock was evident in the way they supported each other through thick and thin.
